oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FORCES ON AND PARTICLE MOTIONS AROUND SUBMERGED STRUCTURES IN STEEP WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Skourup, Jesper
Jonsson, Ivar G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: particle motion
submerged structure
steep waves
wave force
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A boundary integral equation method combined with a non-linear time stepping procedure for the free water surface is developed for simulations of the interaction between highly non-linear water waves and fixed submerged horizontal cylinders. The wave forces on the cylinders are computed and a good correspondence is found with other computed results for low Keulegan-Carpenter numbers. A new method for tracing the orbits of water particles in the fluid domain is developed, and the influence from submerged structures on the orbits is visualized through some computational examples.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
